Britanska kraljica se je odpovedala krznu
07 Nov 2019, 15:53 by STA

Britanska kraljica je borce za pravice živali razveselila z odločitvijo, da ne bo več nosila krznenih izdelkov. Britanska vojska na drugi strani spoštuje tradicijo, tako da bodo znameniti pripadniki kraljeve garde pred Buchinghamsko palačo še naprej nosili znamenita pokrivala iz medvedjega krzna.



Kraljica Elizabeta II. ne bo več nosila krzna. Foto: Profimedia

LONDON > “Ni načrtov, da bi nadomestili medvedje krzno za ceremonialna pokrivala,” so za nemško tiskovno agencijo dpa sporočili iz britanskega obrambnega ministrstva. Organizacije za pravice živeli zahtevajo tovrstne spremembe že več let.
45 centimetrov velika pokrivala kraljeve garde so priljubljen fotografski motiv turistov iz vsega sveta. Izdelujejo jih iz krzna kanadskega črnega medveda. Odstrel medvedov poteka v okviru programa, s katerim obvladujejo številčnost medvedje populacije. Britanska vlada vedno znova zatrjuje, da medvedov nikoli ne lovijo izključno zaradi pokrival.
Sintetično krzno manj trpežno
Cena medvedjega krzna ni določena, ga pa britanska vlada kupuje po potrebi na dražbah v Kanadi, zaradi česar je cena lahko zelo različna, so pojasnili v Londonu. Po navedbah borcev za pravice živali naj bi eno pokrivalo pripadnika kraljeve garde iz medvedjega krzna stalo približno tisoč evrov.
Britansko obrambo ministrstvo je leta 2016 objavilo, da so od leta 2008 kupili 925 pokrival iz medvedjega krzna in za to odšteli približno 880.000 britanskih funtov. Poleg tega so tudi kupili 55 pokrival iz kunčjega krzna za 25.299 funtov in sedem iz lisičjega krzna za 5499 funtov.
Kot so še povedali v Londonu, so že večkrat preizkusili umetne alternative živalskemu krznu, a se je sintetično krzno slabše odrezalo, saj je bilo manj trpežno in tudi slabše odporno na vremenske vplive. Življenjska doba dobro vzdrževanega pokrivala iz medvedjega krzna je lahko dobrega pol stoletja. Trenutno imajo na zalogi približno 1900 pokrival.
Odločitev je presenetila
Odločitev britanske kraljice, da se odpoveduje krznu, je za številne presenečenje. V minulih letih se je namreč v javnosti večkrat pokazala z različnimi krznenimi plašči. Ob začetku svojega kraljevanja pred 67 leti se je pojavila celo v plašču iz leopardjega krzna.
“Če mora njeno veličanstvo v posebno hladnem vremenu obiskati kakšno prireditev, ima na voljo od letos umetno krzno,” piše v najnovejši knjigi Druga stran kovanca: Kraljica, asistentka in garderoba, ki jo je napisala njena zaupnica Angela Kelly. Buckinghamska palača je potrdila, da so besedilo avtorizirali, drugim komentarjem pa so se odpovedali. Tako tudi niso potrdili, ali so se krznu odpovedali tudi drugi člani kraljeve družine.

The British queen gave up fur
07 Nov 2019, 15:53 by STA

The British Queen cheered on animal rights activists by deciding not to wear fur products anymore. The British Army, on the other hand, respects the tradition, so that prominent members of the Royal Guard will continue to wear famous bear fur hats in front of Buchingham Palace.



Queen Elizabeth II. she will no longer wear fur. Photo: Profimedia

LONDON> "There are no plans to replace bear fur for ceremonial headgear," the British Defense Ministry told dpa. Lives rights organizations have been demanding such changes for years.
The 45 centimeter Royal Guard headgear is a popular photographic motif of tourists from all over the world. They are made from Canadian black bear fur. The killing of bears is part of a program that controls the abundance of bear populations. The British Government has repeatedly stated that bears are never hunted solely for cover.
Synthetic fur less durable
The price of the bear fur is not fixed, but the British government buys it when needed in auctions in Canada, which can make the price very different, London explained. According to animal rights activists, one cover of a member of the Royal Guard's bear fur cost about one thousand euros.
The British Defense Ministry announced in 2016 that they had bought 925 bear fur covers since 2008 and deducted about £ 880,000 for it. In addition, they also bought 55 rabbit fur hats for £ 25,299 and seven fox fur hats for £ 5499.
As they have said in London, artificial alternatives to animal fur have been tried many times, but synthetic fur has underperformed because it is less durable and also less resistant to weathering. The life of a well-maintained bear fur coat can be a good half a century. They currently have about 1900 headgear in stock.
The decision surprised her
The British Queen's decision to give up fur is a surprise to many. In recent years, she has repeatedly shown herself in the public with different fur coats. At the beginning of her reign 67 years ago, she even appeared in a leopard fur coat.
"If Her Majesty has to attend an event in particularly cold weather, she has artificial fur available this year," writes in the latest book The Other Side of the Coin: The Queen, the Assistant and the Wardrobe, written by her confidant Angela Kelly. Buckingham Palace have confirmed that they have authorized the text, but have declined to comment. Nor did they confirm whether other members of the royal family had given up their fur.
